quotes.quote: Set your goals  high, and don't stop till you get there.
You'll fail at a 100% of the goals you don't set.
Big goals  get big results. No goals  get no results or somebody else's results.
People with goals succeed because they know where they are going. It's as simple as that.
Your goals  are the road maps that guide you and show you what is possible for your life.
As you reach your goals, set new ones. That is how you grow and become a more powerful person.

Famous archer, Howard Hill won all of the 267 archery contests he entered. He could hit a bullseye at 50 feet, then split first arrow with the second. Would it be possible for you to shoot better than him? YES, if he were blindfolded! How can you hit a target you can't see? Even worse, how can you hit a target you don't even have!? You need to have GOALS in your life!
Goals provide the energy source that powers our lives. One of the best ways we can get the most from the energy we have is to focus it. That is what goals can do for us; concentrate our energy.
Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
The most important thing about goals is having one.
For me, goals are my road map to the life I want. They have helped me accomplish things I once thought were impossible.
Goals are not only absolutely necessary to motivate us. They are essential to really keep us alive.

The secret to productive goal setting is in establishing clearly defined goals, writing them down and then focusing on them several times a day with words, pictures and emotions as if we've already achieved them.
Goals: There is no telling what you can do when you get inspired by them. There is no telling what you can do when you believe in them. There is no telling what will happen when you act upon them.
Goals are reached with patience and guidance. Goals are like clouds that drift through the skies waiting to be touched. Goals are the ultimate accomplishment of a wheel that is set in motion.
If you're bored with life, if you don't get up every morning with a burning desire to do things, you don't have enough goals.
Although goals are important, having a plan of action is vital to the success of those goals. Having a goal with no plan of action is like wanting to travel to a new destination without having a map.
Don't let your plans or goals become more important than yourself, or the ones you care about!
The more goals you set - the more goals you get.
What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
Without goals, and plans to reach them, you are like a ship that has set sail with no destination.
Think big goals and win big success.

Crystallize your goals. Make a plan for achieving them and set yourself a deadline. Then, with supreme confidence, determination and disregard for obstacles and other people's criticisms, carry out your plan.
Goals are dreams we convert to plans and take action to fulfill.
You must have long-range goals to keep you from being frustrated by short-range failures.
The ultimate reason for setting goals is to entice you to become the person it takes to achieve them.

Setting goals for significant accomplishments you want to achieve in your life, both personal and professional accomplishments, costs you nothing. Failure to set them can cost you plenty. You are smack in the middle of the only life your going to have. You can choose to succeed, or choose to drift; having goals makes the difference.
Goals give you more than a reason to get up in the morning; they are an incentive to keep you going all day. Goals tend to tap the deeper resources and draw the best out of life.

The reason most people never reach their goals is that they don't define them, learn about them or even seriously consider them as believable or acheivable. Winners can tell you where they are going, what they plan to do along the way, and who will be sharing the adventure with them.
An average person with average talents and ambition and average education, can outstrip the most brilliant genius in our society, if that person has clear, focused goals.
Review your goals twice every day in order to be focused on achieving them.
Where are the people who don't have goals headed? Those 97 per cent end up working for the three percent.
When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
You have to set goals that are almost out of reach. If you set a goal that is attainable without much work or thought, you are stuck with something below your true talent and potential.
Your goal should be out of reach but not out of sight.
Goals that are not written down are just wishes.
When we are motivated by goals that have deep meaning, by dreams that need completion, by pure love that needs expressing, then we truly live life.
Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goals.
Goals determine what you're going to be.
There is no achievement without goals.

Set a goal to achieve something that is so big, SO exhilarating that it excites you and scares you at the same time. It must be a goal that is so appealing, so much in line with your spiritual core, that you can't get it out of your mind. If you do not get chills when you set a goal, you're not setting big enough goals.
To have Goals is to have a future, because without goals we will strive for nothing.
Goals allow you to control the direction of change in your favor.

The most important thing you can do to achieve your goals is to make sure that as soon as you set them, you immediately begin to create momentum. The most important rules that I ever adopted to help me in achieving my goals were those I learned from a very successful man who taught me to first write down the goal, and then to never leave the site of setting a goal without firs taking some form of positive action toward its attainment.
You must take action now that will move you towards your goals. Develop a sense of urgency in your life.
Goals help you overcome short-term problems.
If what you are doing is not moving you towards your goals, then it's moving you away from your goals.
Establishing goals is all right if you don't let them deprive you of interesting detours.
Goals are dreams with deadlines.
People are not lazy. They simply have impotent goals â€“ that is, goals that do not inspire them.
If you go to work on your goals, your goals will go to work on you. If you go to work on your plan, your plan will go to work on you. Whatever good things we build end up building us.
A person without ambition is like an lifeless object and when you work with an ambition, no goal is difficult to achieve.
Leaders aren't born they are made. And they are made just like anything else, through hard work. And that's the price we'll have to pay to achieve that goal, or any goal.
What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goals to reach.
A goal without an action plan is a daydream.
You need a plan to build a house. To build a life, it is even more important to have a plan or goal.
A good goal is like a strenuous exercise - it makes you stretch.
Goals are the sweetest fruits of the most bitter trials of life.
Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.
If you're going to be able to look back on something and laugh about it, you might as well laugh about it now.
You can get everything in life you want if you will just help enough other people get what they want.
The trouble with not having a goal is that you can spend your life running up and down the field and never score.
Go as far as you can see, and when you get there you will see farther.
Goals are not only absolutely necessary to motivate us. They are essential to really keep us alive.
Everybody has their own Mount Everest they were put on this earth to climb.
We are kept from our goal not by obstacles but by a clear path to a lesser goal.
This one step â€“ choosing a goal and sticking to it â€“ changes everything.
Your goals are the road maps that guide you and show you what is possible for your life.
Our goals can only be reached through a vehicle of a plan, in which we must fervently believe, and upon which we must vigorously act. There is no other route to success.
By recording your dreams and goals on paper, you set in motion the process of becoming the person you most want to be. Put your future in good hands â€” your own.
Goals determine what you're going to be.
You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
Goals are the end results of a long hard struggle that is considered the fruit of all efforts.
It is never too late to be who you might have been.
Desire is the key to motivation, but it's determination and commitment to an unrelenting pursuit of your goal â€” a commitment to excellence â€” that will enable you to attain the success you seek.
All who have accomplished great things have had a great aim, have fixed their gaze on a goal which was high, one which sometimes seemed impossible.
It's better to be at the bottom of the ladder you want to climb than at the top of the one you don't.
Goals are discovered, not made.
Goals are accomplished when accomplishment rules the heart and mind.
The road leading to a goal does not separate you from the destination; it is essentially a part of it.
You cannot change your destination overnight, but you can change your direction overnight.
A goal properly set is halfway reached.
Without some goals and some efforts to reach it, no man can live.
We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things.
All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
A goal is not always meant to be reached, it often serves simply as something to aim at.
I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
Without some goal and some effort to reach it, no one can live.
Obstacles are those things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.
It is not the mountain we conquer but ourselves.
If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.
